senses.de: To make sad or unsatisfied by not being as good as expected or desired
senses.ex: Her performance in the match disappointed her coach.

Tips.title: Anticipation Matters
Tips.description: The sense of failure is stronger if high expectations are not met.
Tips.example: He disappointed his fans by cancelling the highly anticipated concert.

Tips.title: Subjectivity
Tips.description: What disappoints someone may not disappoint another; it's often a personal feeling.
Tips.example: The movie disappointed me, but my sister loved it.

Tips.title: Not Always Serious
Tips.description: 'Disappoint' can be used in light situations and doesn't always mean deep sadness.
Tips.example: I was disappointed by the lack of chocolate chips in my cookie.

Defeat.wordDefinition:
Defeat means to overcome or conquer someone or something in a competition or battle. It is applicable in situations where there is a clear winner and loser, like in a sports match or a war.

To summarize, defeat refers to winning or losing in a competition, while disappoint refers to failing to meet expectations.

Depress.wordDefinition:
Depress refers to a feeling of sadness, hopelessness, and a loss of motivation or energy. This feeling can be long-term or short-term and can be caused by a variety of factors such as a difficult situation, a loss, or a chemical imbalance in the brain.

This can be due to a failure or a letdown, but it typically does not have the same level of severity or long-term impact as depression.

To put it in a simple way, depression is a feeling of sadness and hopelessness which can last for a long time, while disappointment is a feeling of sadness or dissatisfaction in response to a specific event or situation that did not meet one's expectations.

Dismay.wordDefinition:
Dismay means to cause someone to feel distress or fear. For example, if you found out that your house was broken into, you would feel dismayed.

Disappoint is used when something doesn't live up to your expectations and dismay is used when something causes you to feel distress or fear.

Displease.wordDefinition:
Displease means to make someone unhappy or unsatisfied. This means that the person may not necessarily have expected something better, but they are not happy with what they received.

Disappoint is used when expectations are unmet, and displease is used when something fails to make someone happy.

Fail.wordDefinition:
Fail means to not succeed in achieving a goal or objective. It is applicable in situations where there is a clear and defined outcome that was not achieved, like failing an exam or losing a competition.

Disappoint is a subjective feeling of unhappiness or dissatisfaction while fail is an objective result of not achieving a goal or objective.

Frustrate.wordDefinition:
Frustrate means to feel annoyed or irritated when something is not working the way you want it to. For example, if you were trying to assemble a puzzle but kept getting stuck, you would feel frustrated.

The difference between the two words is that disappoint is more related to emotions and expectations, while frustrate is more related to obstacles and challenges.

Both words describe feelings of unhappiness, but disappoint has more to do with disappointment in a person or situation, while frustrate has more to do with the annoyance caused by a problem or obstacle.

Hinder.wordDefinition:
Hinder means to create an obstacle or barrier that stops someone or something from making progress or achieving a goal.

For example, if you were trying to write an essay but your noisy neighbors kept talking loudly outside your window, they would be hindering your ability to concentrate.

Disappoint relates to emotions, while hinder relates to obstacles or barriers that prevent progress.

Let down.wordDefinition:
The phrase let down means to feel disappointed or betrayed by someone who didn't do what they said they would do. For example, if your friend promised to help you with a project but didn't show up, you would feel let down.

Both words imply a feeling of sadness or upset, but disappoint is more about events or circumstances not meeting expectations, while let down is more about people not living up to their promises or obligations.

Sadden.wordDefinition:
Sadden means to feel sad or unhappy, often because of something upsetting or tragic that has happened. For example, if you heard about a friend's pet passing away, you might be saddened by the news.

Disappoint is used when something doesn't live up to expectation whereas sadden is used when something makes one feel sad.

quotes.Text: I've done well, I've been disappointed, and I think it all goes back to you. Of course the labels are going to be the labels. It's the music business. You are a business. That's what they do. So you've got to protect yourself.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mary J. Blige

quotes.Text: Life is life, and one has experiences that are painful and some that are very pleasant, and one has reward and sacrifice and more reward and disappointment and joy and happiness, and it's always going to be the same.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Mel Gibson

quotes.Text: It is foolish to pretend that one is fully recovered from a disappointed passion. Such wounds always leave a scar.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.Text: I don't like being disappointed by somebody I trust. Fortunately, it rarely happens.
quotes.Title: French Chef
quotes.Name: Alain Ducasse

quotes.Text: If humanity doesn't land on Mars in my lifetime, I would be very disappointed.
quotes.Title: South African Businessman
quotes.Name: Elon Musk

quotes.Text: My fans are so important to me, and I would never want to disappoint them.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Selena Gomez

quotes.Text: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
quotes.Title: American Leader
quotes.Name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.Text: I feared disappointing my father more than anything in the world.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actor
quotes.Name: Ryan Reynolds

quotes.Text: Presidents often disappoint, but first ladies rarely do.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Kitty Kelley
